alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Jennings (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jackson and southern Jennings Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 341 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Seymour, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Jackson and southern Jennings Counties, including the following locations... Paris Crossing and Crothersville. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 37 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Indiana.
